EXTRACTED VALUE: Navarro is another player to have not played for his country but included in Luis Aragones' 23-man squad for this summer's finals.
The languid front man may find it difficult to settle at club level, but he often delivers when called upon for his country.
The rising star of Swiss football, Derdiyok looks likely to secure a move to one of Europe's biggest clubs in the near future.
At five feet, seven inches tall, it is unlikely Salpingidis will have many defences quaking in their boots this summer.
Versatile performer Larsson will be hoping to carry his fine form in the Premier League into this summer's finals.
The AC Milan left-back was an instrumental figure during qualifying and chipped in with a couple of goals.
Dorsin is likely to start as Sweden's first-choice left back at the finals following the injury to Erik Edman.
Sagnol is a solid right-back who has been playing in the Bundesliga with Bayern Munich since 2000.
Could be one to watch in Austria and Switzerland and is rated as a rising star in Greece.
Hugely experienced midfielder who will likely hold one of the two defensive midfielder roles in Marco van Basten's 4-2-3-1 formation.
Xavi is as instrumental for Spain as he is for his club Barcelona. On his day, he is one of the most effective midfield players in world football.
Despite featuring just once in Euro 2008 qualifying, Dario Knezevic was selected as Slaven Bilic's back-up central defender for the tournament itself.
A well known face to supporters of Bolton and all followers of the Premier League.
The Nurnberg goalkeeper is unlikely to oust Petr Cech during the tournament but will provide valuable experience on the bench.
Highly-rated striker Semih Senturk looks to be finding the best form of his career just in time for the Euro 2008 finals.
Experienced goalkeeper Henk Timmer will serve as Holland's number three goalkeeper during Euro 2008.
The bright young thing of Austrian football, Harnik was born in Germany but qualifies for Josef Hickersberger's squad by virtue of a father from Graz.
Now limited to appearances from the bench, but in Liberopoulos Greece have their very own super sub.
Zlatan Ibrahimovic has arguably overtaken Henrik Larsson as Sweden's leading player.
No Croatian striker has yet come close to emulating the feats of the legendary Davor Suker - but there are high hopes for Nikola Kalinic.
Gornik Zabrze midfielder Michal Pazdan is one of Beenhakker's freshest faces having made just a handful of appearances for his country.
The 31-year-old Sevilla goalkeeper has only received international recognition in recent years following a number of impressive seasons at Udinese.
A lynchpin of the Dutch side at just 23 and with nearly 50 caps to his name, Wesley Sneijder is one of Holland's key men.
Olympiakos defender Zewlakow, like so many in Beenhakker's squad, brings a wealth of experience to the table.
Johan Elmander is a much in-demand striker after a terrific two-years with Toulouse, and he could even move on before Euro 2008 begins.
The France skipper, despite inconsistent performances for Inter Milan recently, is a key member of Raymond Domenech's squad for Euro 2008.
The experienced and well-travelled Emre Asik has proved his worth as a regular member of the Turkey squad over the years.
A veteran of both the 2002 and 2006 World Cup campaigns, yet remarkably this will be Neuville's first shot at winning the European Championship.
A rising star in the Romanian defence, Gabriel Tamas is another stopper in the squad who possesses an eye for goal.
Olof Mellberg will be a key member of the Sweden side at Euro 2008.
A versatile defender with plenty of promise, Cristian Sapunaru is another former Under 21 star likely to be going along for the experience.
Roman Adamov is a man who has struggled for form of late but is still a player rated highly by Russia coach Guus Hiddink.
A battling midfielder with a penchant for picking up yellow cards, Paul Codrea adds steel to Romania's engine room.
The young keeper's star has been on the rise for a number of years and culminated in him securing a move to Bundesliga side Wolfsburg in January 2008.
An experienced winger, Florentin Petre will be appearing at his second European Championship finals this summer.
Experienced midfielder Ayhan Akman has slipped back to the fringes of the Turkey side in recent years.
A commanding presence in the centre of the park, Huggel is a no-nonsense defensive midfielder who likes to throw his weight around.
Romania's top scorer in qualifying and the biggest name in their squad, Adrian Mutu will be aiming to seize his chance on the international stage.
Valencia's Silva is a bright and promising winger, who is sure to dazzle at this summer's finals.
A skilful midfielder with an eye for goal, Razvan Cocis has the ability to turn a game in Romania's favour against the big teams.
Captain of the national team, Romania will be pinning their hopes on defender Cristian Chivu having an exemplary tournament.
The versatile Aston Villa defender is a vital member of Marco van Basten's squad.
The silver-haired shot-stopper who will spring to the minds of football followers around the world when they picture a Greek goalkeeper.
Lokomotiv Moscow midfielder Dmitri Torbinskiy is capable of filling in a variety of positions, equally comfortable in central or left-sided roles.
Henrik Larsson has come out of international retirement for the second time for Sweden for Euro 2008
Adam Kokoszka is one of Poland's brightest prospects and Euro 2008 is likely to give the 21-year-old invaluable experience for the future.
They do not come much more experienced than Poland international defender Jacek Bak.
Andreas Isaksson is firmly the established number one goalkeeper for Sweden and will remain first-choice despite his struggles at Manchester City.
The supremely deft 21-year-old is already regarded, by most, to be one of the world's best midfielders.
The experienced midfielder is set for his swansong at international level in Austria and Switzerland.
At the heart of Russia's backline is likely to be the uncompromising presence of CSKA Moscow's Alexsei Berezutskiy.
The least experienced member of Guus Hiddink's Russia squad is newcomer Renat Yanbaev.
Joris Mathijsen is a commanding presence at the heart of the Dutch defence.
Markus Rosenberg has failed to hit the heights expected of him on the international scene.
Denis Kolodin has limited experience of football outside of his native Russia, having never played in Europe or a major international tournament.
Borowski was once identified by Karl-Heinz Rummenigge as a potential successor to Michael Ballack, but injuries have dealt him a cruel hand.
Clerc is set to be first choice right-back Willy Sagnol's deputy this summer and he is unlikely to get much game time.
Govou is an experienced winger who has been a key member of the Lyon side that has won the last seven Ligue 1 titles.
They won't come much older than Vastic at the European Championship.
Celtic striker Jan Vennegoor of Hesselink will provide valuable back-up from the bench during Euro 2008 for Dutch coach Marco van Basten.
Lilian Thuram is France's most capped player of all time and he was part of Les Bleus' winning squad at both the 1998 World Cup and Euro 2000.
Puyol has gone about his work at international and club level in impressive fashion, demonstrating solidarity throughout his career.
After heartbreak at the previous two tournaments Rafael van der Vaart will be looking to make an impact in Austria & Switzerland.
Guerreiro is Beenhakker's ace in the pack after only just qualifying for Poland's squad months before the finals in Austria and Switzerland.
A technically gifted midfielder, Plasil has been saddled with the inevitable but perhaps unhelpful tag of the 'new Nedved'.
Diarra is finally starting to show the form which has seen him labelled one of Europe's most promising midfield players.
Klaas Jan Huntelaar is the new big hope of Dutch football and he is currently one of the most sought after strikers in Europe.
Jakub Wawrzyniak's inclusion in Leo Beenhakker's 23-man squad comes as a surprise as he made just seven appearances for Legia Warsaw last season.
Juanito is an experienced defender who boasts bags of experience and is currently captain of Real Betis.
The tough-tackling Pogatetz will be a key player for Austria this summer, as long as he avoids another falling-out with coach Josef Hickersberger.
At 28-years-old, Valencia defender Marchena, who can also play in midfield, is peaking just in time for the Euro 2008 finals.
Shakhtar Donetsk's defensive midfielder Mariusz Lewandowski was a key member of Poland's qualifying campaign for Euro 2008.
In four short years Inler has gone from being a virtual unknown to an international regular and much sought-after midfield star.
Galatasary defender Emre Gungor was a late inclusion in Fatih Terim's plans for Euro 2008 after right-back Gokhan Gonul was ruled out through injury.
After firing five goals from nine appearances in qualifying, Gekas looks certain to lead the line.
Promising young defender who is dubbed 'the new Chivu', Stefan Radu could view Euro 2008 as an opportunity to accrue experience.
Vladimir Gabulov travels to Austria and Switzerland as Russia's third choice goalkeeper behind Igor Akinfeev and Vyacheslav Malafeev.
Petter Hansson is a reliable defender for both club and country.
Back to full fitness after a serious knee injury, Sorin Ghionea will be determined to force his way into Victor Piturca's starting line-up.
Kuyt was in real danger of missing out Euro 2008, but an impressive late run of form has seen him make Marco van Basten's final squad.
Anders Svensson is another member of the Sweden squad with Premiership experience.
Still just 23, Schweinsteiger can already be considered a mainstay of both the German national team and club side Bayern Munich.
FC Copenhagen right-back Zdenek Pospech is likely to find his path to the first XI blocked by Tomas Ujfalusi and Zdenek Grygera.
A towering centre-back with an eye for goal, Dorin Goian could find himself on the move after the tournament.
For all his World Cup heroics, the European Championship represents unfinished business for the prolific Klose.
Central defender Granqvist is likely to be squad player for Sweden at the finals.
Kyrgiakos should partner Traianos Dellas at the heart of the Greek defence after also playing an ever-present role in qualifying.
Middlesbrough forward Tuncay Sanli will be one of Turkey's main threats come the finals in Austria & Switzerland.
Had things turned out differently it could well have been Enke and not Jens Lehmann playing here as an Arsenal and Germany goalkeeper.
Christian Wilhelmsson is one of Sweden's unsung heroes after bursting onto the scene before Euro 2004.
Versatile two-football star Dudka is equally adept at playing in defence or in midfield.
Attacking midfielder Sionko will be familiar to Rangers' fans after spending the 2006-7 season with the Scottish giants.
Key to Russia's defensive solidity in Austria and Switzerland could be the performance of CSKA Moscow defender Sergei Ignashevich.
Highly-rated midfielder De la Red could be set to light up this summer's finals after an excellent season for Getafe.
A reliable left-footed defender who boasts UEFA Champions League experience at club level with Panathinaikos and can provide stability if required.
Katsouranis has been a regular in the centre of midfield over recent years and it is unlikely he will lose his place ahead of the finals.
Young French-born striker Mevlut Erdinc was something of a shock inclusion in Fatih Terim's squad for Euro 2008.
Squillaci is one of a number of Lyon players who have been named in France's squad for this summer's tournament.
Anderlecht ace Marcin Wasilewski is expected to be Leo Beenhakker's first choice right-back for this summer's tournament.
The Swiss golden boy is one of the most consistent strikers in Europe, and his country's all time top goal scorer.
28-year-old Engelaar has only recently made the breakthrough into the Dutch national aide.
The lofty Nurnberg striker will forever be remembered as the man who scored Greece's winning goal in the final victory over Portugal at Euro 2004.
Marcus Allback is a proven goalscorer on the international stage even though he has not always performed at club level.
The 22-year-old defender caught Luis Aragones' attention after numerous consistent displays for his club Valencia.
Nicolas Anelka, after what has been a stuttering international career at times, finally seems to have become a key player for France.
Vying for a place in Guus Hiddink's attack will be Lokomotiv Moscow striker Dmitri Sychev, a player once labelled the 'Russian Michael Owen'.
After swapping Celtic in the January transfer window for Larissa and the sunnier climate of Greece Zurawski has enjoyed a renaissance in form.
A natural leader, Mirel Radoi could prove to be a useful utility player in the Romania squad in Austria and Switzerland.
Galatasary's Sabri Sarioglu is another player who brings added versatility to Fatih Terim's squad.
One of the new breed in this squad to have come through since Joachim Low was appointed national coach, Trochowski is another of Polish birth.
An exciting, aggressive but injury-prone right-back, Grygera has gone past 50 international caps since making his debut against South Korea in 2001.
Galatasary winger Arda Turan is one of the most exciting young talents in Fatih Terim's Turkey side.
The 28-year-old Celtic keeper travels to Euro 2008 as his country's number one goalkeeper who on his day is regarded one of the world's best.
Lukasz Gargula will provide coach Leo Beenhakker will midfielder cover for this summer's Euro 2008.
Tobias Linderoth performs a key role in the Swedish side for coach Lars Lagerback.
Niclas Andersson is one of the most experienced players in the Sweden squad for Euro 2008.
One of the elder statesmen of the Croatian team and also a vice-captain, Dario Simic is set to win his 100th cap at Euro 2008.
A direct running winger, Banel Nicolita will be looking to confirm his early promise at the European Championship.
FC Moscow defender Mariusz Jop has been on the international scene for a number of years without being a regular.
Liverpool's Arbeloa is a versatile defender, who has proved a reliable squad member since he arrived at Anfield in 2007.
Olympiakos full-back Christos will add a resourceful aspect to Greece's squad as he is also capable of operating in midfield.
The Roma midfielder De Rossi featured in every qualifying match for Italy and even captained the side in the final match against Faroe Islands.
A lively option for Greece and a player capable of operating on the left wing or in attack.
The 23-year-old Aquilani has been tipped for the top following a series of impressive performances for his boyhood heroes Roma.
Van Persie will be keen to put a frustrating domestic campaign behind him and shine at this summer's finals.
Rami Shaaban will provide goalkeeping cover for Andreas Isaksson at the finals.
The AZ Alkmaar midfielder is one of the real unknown quantities outside of Holland but Demy de Zeeuw is in line to start for Marco van Basten.
Iniesta worked his way through Barcelona's youth academy to become an integral player in Frank Rijkaard and then Luis Aragones' sides.
Villarreal's Capdevila is likely to fill the left-back berth in Aragones' side this summer.
Marius Niculae has seen his career revived over the past 12 months and now appears to be an important part of the Romania squad.
Gornik Zabrze striker Tomasz Zahorski pipped Radoslaw Matusiak as Poland's fifth choice striker this summer.
Toulalan is one of several players in the France squad who have helped Lyon win their seventh straight Ligue 1 title this season.
Outstanding winger who is the most expensive player in Dutch football history.
Garcia is another interesting inclusion by manager Aragones, specifically as the front man has been anything-but prolific for his club.
Prodl is one of Austria's brightest prospects for the future and will be hoping to make a big impact in front of a wider audience this summer.
Sergei Semak's return to the Russia fold for Euro 2008 has surprised many after two years in the international wilderness under Guus Hiddink's tenure.
The Czech Republic's qualifiying campaign was built on their stout defence.
Jose Reina, son of Miguel, has broken numerous records for his club Liverpool and provides Aragones with sound back-up for Casillas.
One of European football's future kings, this could be the tournament that Karim Benzema announces his arrival as a superstar.
Captain Ivanschitz is one of Austria's chief playmakers and his form will be a key barometer as to how far the co-hosts can progress this summer.
A versatile midfielder, Matejovsky is probably best known in England for the stunning goal he scored for Reading at Liverpool earlier this season.
Germany's captain and figurehead, Ballack is on course for a century of caps and has already proved his class on the biggest stage of all.
Gokdeniz Karadeniz ended his nine-year association with Trabzonspor in March of this year when he signed for Russian club Rubin Kazan.
Talented full-back with an eye for going forward, Razvan Rat is expected to start on the left side for Romania at Euro 2008.
The experienced centre-half has endured an injury-plagued 2007/08 campaign and his inclusion in the squad has come as something of a surprise.
Another certain starter and a regular fixture in qualifying as he continues to hold down the playmaking role he has occupied since 2004.
A back-up goalkeeper to Bogdan Lobont, Marius Cornel Popa is likely to just be gaining experience on the bench at Euro 2008.
Versatile Fiorentina defender who could start at right-back for the Czechs in Austria and Switzerland.
Leitgeb is the sort of player who makes what can be a complicated game look simple.
An experienced full-back with a penchant for going forward, Cosmin Contra will ensure opposition wingers will be on their toes.
One of Holland's most accomplished performers, his contribution will be vital to his country's chances of success in Austria & Switzerland.
Highly-rated playmaker who is still playing in his homeland, Nicolae Dica could use Euro 2008 as a springboard to a big move.
Like his fellow midfield compatriots, Alonso oozes outstanding technique, with an eye for a pin-point pass.
Daniel Anderson is now a back-up player in the Sweden squad after being a regular in the side for years before.
Like a number of his international and club team-mates, AC Milan's Pirlo has won almost everything there is to win in the game.
Roman Shirokov is a player short on international experience but not talent having starred for Zenit Saint Petersburg this season.
Korkmaz is yet another of those players to force their way into the squad through their recent form for domestic title winners Rapid Vienna.
Wiland will make the trip to Austria and Switzerland as third-choice goalkeeper in Lars Lagerback's plans.
Mandanda is a surprise choice in France's squad for Euro 2008 after only making his international debut against Ecuador on May 27.
'El Nino' will be keen to continue his devastating club form during this summer's finals.
Greece's captain and a shoe-in for a starting spot in the heart of midfield as plans begin for another shock success.
A relatively new arrival in the squad having only made his international debut in October 2006, Fritz is one of Germany's lower-profile players.
The AC Milan veteran is perhaps not one for the purists, but his effectiveness cannot be called into question.
Guiza is relatively new to the international scene after making his international bow last November.
Tumer Metin may be without a club, but he has the perfect opportunity to showcase his midfield talents at Euro 2008.
Sturm Graz's captain at just 23, Saumel operates in defensive midfield and has progressed through the Austrian youth levels into the national side.
Aufhauser is a veteren of the Austrian Bundesliga and, after years of hard work, can be considered an integral part of the national squad.
Gomis appears to be Raymond Domenech's wildcard selection after he edged out Marseille striker Djibril Cisse for a place in France's 23-man squad.
Touted as the new Theodoros Zagorakis, but Tziolis has yet to live up to the billing of Greece's legendary former captain.
Better known to fans of the English game as Colin Kazim-Richards, the Fenerbahce midfielder gives hope to footballers everywhere.
Andre Ooijer is one of Holland's most reliable defenders, be it whether he features at right-back or in central defence.
Brazilian-born Mehmet Aurelio became the first naturalised player to feature for Turkey when he made his debut against Luxembourg in August 2006.
The Wolfsburg midfielder will be a key element in Leo Beenhakker's squad for this summer's Championship in Austria and Switzerland this summer.
A steady defender, Cosmin Moti is unlikely to play a prominent role in Romania's European Championship campaign.
Arsenal's promising keeper Fabianski travels to Austria and Switzerland this summer as his country's third choice shot-stopper.
Fuchs has the potential to become a key player for Austria - and can use Euro 2008 as an opportunity to really make a name for himself.
Tolga Zengin was not involved during the Euro 2008 qualification campaign, but has been given the nod for the finals in Austria and Switzerland.
Freddie Ljungberg will captain Sweden at Euro 2008 after overcoming injury which threatened to rule him out.
Stoor is a relative newcomer into the Sweden squad after making his debut earlier this year.
Born in Argentina, Juventus winger Camoranesi qualifies to play for Italy through his grandparents.
Ivan Saenko heads to Euro 2008 on the back of a disappointing domestic campaign that ended with his club FC Nurnberg being relegated.
Vastly-experienced Newcastle midfielder Emre is expected to be a key member of Fatih Terim's side at this summer's Euro 2008 finals.
The 26-year-old is a versatile midfielder with the ability to slot comfortably into a number of positions.
Ugur Boral earned his place in the squad for this summer's finals despite not appearing in the Euro 2008 qualification campaign.
The Brazilian-born midfielder is renowned for his tough-tackling qualities and ability to snuff out the opposition's attack.
Giant striker Koller remains one of the most fearsome forwards in world football.
Holland's outstanding number one will be making his international swansong at Euro 2008.
Ozcan was a late replacement for Helge Payer after he was dramatically forced out the day before Austria's final squad was named.
Kim Kallstrom is the mainstay of Sweden's midfield and will be crucial to their hopes of success during Euro 2008.
The versatile Behrami is equally at home in defence as he is in midfield, and is able to operate on either flank.
Patrice Evra has now fully adapted to life in England with Manchester United after a difficult start to his time in the Premier League.
Gomez's form this season presents Joachim Low with perhaps his biggest dilemma as he plots Germany's European Championship campaign.
Zenit Saint Petersburg midfielder Konstantin Zyrianov is a man in a rich vein of form heading into Euro 2008.
A surprise selection when picked by Jurgen Klinsmann for the 2006 World Cup, Odonkor could be considered the same this time around.
Villarreal's Cazorla is a surprise inclusion by Aragones having not yet landed a senior international cap.
